subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] QS-SAMPA: a proposed format for plain-text Quickscript
msgSnippet: I actually suggested releasing a new version of Thoth that uses the QS-SAMPA mapping. Let s call it Thoth No. 2 for the moment. This would allow people to
messageBody:
I actually suggested releasing a new version of Thoth that uses the
QS-SAMPA mapping. Let's call it Thoth No. 2 for the moment. This would
allow people to install and use the new version side-by-side with the
old one, leaving any documents that were created with the original
Thoth unaffected. It would make sense for new development to continue
with Thoth No. 2, while Thoth would remain in its present state.

Ted

PS. Small correction: you meant 'H' instead of 'F' below for the
present assignment for Thither.

On Nov 29, 2007 6:47 PM, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Ted Larson Freeman wrote:
> >
> >
> > I would like to propose that we adopt a single-character plain text
> > (ASCII) representation for the Read Alphabet, called QS-SAMPA. The
> > name reflects its origin as an adaptation of the X-SAMPA phonetic
> > alphabet (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X-SAMPA
> > <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X-SAMPA>). At the moment, we are
> > using heterogeneous notations, sometimes using names from the
> > Quickscript Manual, sometimes using letter numbers, and sometimes
> > using the revised names proposed by Jon Zuck. This is inconvenient.
>
> Ted is proposing that we change the basic letters (or mapping) in fonts.
> Right now, when you press "F" on the keyboard, you see the letter
> Thither. Under the new proposal, when you would have to type "D" to see
> Thither.
>
> Here is a list of the proposed changes.
>
> Thither was F => D
>
> Whiteweath was `=> W
>
> If was i => I
>
> Eat was I =>i
>
> Ed was e => E
>
> Age was E => e
>
> Ash was A => a
>
> Ice was F => Y
>
> Ah was y => A
>
> Awl was Y => O
>
> On was o > Q
>
> Oy was q => R
>
> Ado was a => y
>
> Out was Q => H
>
> Oak was O => o
>
> Ted has asked me to change the font Thoth, and I have agreed if the
> group also agrees. I need people to weigh in so I know what to do.
>
> I personally vote for the change, since it would make email a bit
> easier. Keep in mind that I don't have years of learning the current
> keyboard, so I don't have to learn anything new.
>
> Paul
>
>
